text: CHIANG MAI VS CHIANG RAI LIVING IN THAILAND
i think it might be about time
to give eden a hair cut, shes looking a bit
scruffy what do you think?
you seem to have grown as well
there you are eden! it was all a trick, you're still small.
arent you? so whos dis, hm? who dis
eden the dog, chloe the dog, dont you look like a big scruffy eden
we are back in chiang mai, we are dog sitting
and house sitting for friends while they go away, edens got a nice little friend to
play with and they seem to be getting on nicely
so alll is well, j is already working on the next montly special
we are heading out today, to one of chiang mais most unique temples
wat umong, we will see you there!
to the temple
k, we are at wat umong, also known as the forest temple
because its in a forest
theres interesting underground tunnels and chapels
and its in a nice foresty natural setting
so lets go and have a look around
theres over 300 temples in chiang mai
when we very first moved here
we had this idea that we were gonna go and see them all
obviously that didnt happen
theres far too many
thats one of the diferences between living in chiang rai
theres less buddhist temples
and theres actually quite a lot of churches, christan churches
much more than there are in chiang mai
theres a a king mengrai statue here as well
like what we have in chiang rai
js gone ahead of me cos hes filming the timelapse
according to what i just read on that sign
this temple was built so that monks who studied in the city
could have a solitude and place to come and meditate
in peace and quiet in the forest
so thats how this temple came about
this is where you enter the under ground tunnels
its quite a cool little temple to come and explore
theres all these tunnels and little alcoves buddha shrines
this section of the tunnel actually feels quite low
its not often that i feel tall
but this is one situation
you can see how close my head is to the ceiling
much taller than 5'2 you will have to be prepared to duck in places
so at the end of the tunnel
you come out on the other side
into the forest
up these steps we have the stupa
im not entirely sure what the tunnels were built for
what there meant for so im gonn ahave to find out
you leave your shoes at the other side of the temple
so when you do come out at the other end
in the forest
you do have to walk around in bare foot or socked feet
in the leaves ands tuff
just be prepared for that
dont put your good socks on
look who i found
its jmayel
back together
theres a lot of noise going on
lots of banging drums
and theres lots and lots of people here today
so im not sure if its a special day
i dont realyl know whats going on here
were gonna have to find out
its not ideal for me as theres lots of people in the tunnels and im trying to do a hyperlapse
im blocking everyones way
just reading a couple of signs to find out why the tunnels are here
but it doesnt say anything
it just says they built a tunnel
so i guess theres no reason
they just fancied a tunnel
better go and find my partner for life, havent seen him for a while
so much for the quiet temple where the monks can relax in the forest
so all the commotion is because they are ordaining new monks
theyve all got their freshly shaven heads and wearing the white robes
all their families are dancing
so its quite nice to see
so thats whats happening today
now we know
after our initial thought that we were going to visit all the temples in chiang mai
had a few that we liked particularly
we did see quite a good amount
trying to get through all 300 plus is a bit of an ambitious task
but if your feeling up to it
something to take up quite a bit of time if you come to chiang mai
also its nice when there different from each other
you do find a lot of the temples there all very samey
once youve seen one in a particular style then youve kind of seen them all
thats how i feel about it anyway
its heating up now
ive got a scarf on
need to get this off now
i think were almost done at the temple
we can head on somewhere else
think were gonna go and get some lunch now
woohoo
js just finishing up the timelapse out there and then were good to go
all done
if you think a steady cam workout is hard
try holding the camera out like that for 250 shots over 10 minutes in the sun
well you want muscles dont you
wat umong
finished
its not even mid day yet but its super hot already
so were gonna go and get a nice cold drink somewhere now
the difference between driving in chiang mai and chiang rai
is its a lot busier
theres a lot more people on the streets
and the moat road that surrounds the city
you have to be very aware that someones not cutting in on your left and right all the time
i think that the driving around in the city is more difficult in chiang mai definitely
got to be more aware
of motorbikes and traffic
another big difference between chiang rai and chiang mai
is that chiang mai has a huge
huge expat community
much bigger than chiang rai
that we know if anyway
chiang mai is the place to go if you definitely want to be intergrated fully in an expat community
if you want a big social scene and your really into expat commuities then chiang mai is definitely
better than chiang rai
yeah
food
were just come to one of our cafes we used to come to quite a bit when we lived here
dindee cafe
its nice they do good food
vegetarian and really nice smoothies
i like the sound of that
sacha went for an iced masala chai
masalary
chickpea curry with vegetable soup
and brown rice
doesnt realyl seem to matter where you are in chiang mai
you can always here planes flying overhead
thats something that weve forgotten about
chiang rai we dont here the planes at all
so that was nice vegetarian place to eat
yeah i like it there
nice and full now
i think thats another difference between chiang mai and chiang rai
theres a much bigger vegetarian and vegan food scene here
if youre a vegan you can find a lot more restaurants here than you can in chiang rai
definitely
ok back to the car
you didnt really think that was our car did you
thats in better condition that our car
poor car
we shouldnt be insulting it
it takes us everywhere
monster number 2
yeah you got your little puppy
nice
good girl

we are about to go out and film a timelaspeof the moat
on our car like this
for my episode of the month
then were going to get some coffee in one of our favorite specialist coffee shops
so ill see you there
we are at asama cafe
she is a really good barista
she makes great coffee
which is what were excited about
mae hong son had poo coffee
come with us
this is asama she makes speciality coffees that we havent seen anywhere else
so thats why we like it
thats amazing
that was most definitely the best coffee ive had for weeks
absolutely amazing
sachas gravity was something weve never tried before
amazing
thanks asama
if there was one thing we can definitely say we miss about chiang mai
is the high end grocery store rimping
its only in chiang mai
it is brillient
another little difference weve noticed
is that the groceries seem to be a tiny bit cheaper in chiang mai
like by a  few baht
not that much
everything seems to be a bit cheaper
its because of the distance the stuff has to travel maybe
now were gonna go and watch chappie at the cinema
another massive difference between chiang rai and chaing mai
is the cinemas
the amounf of cinemas we have here is quadruple
and there so much better as well
youve got an imax, 4d cinemas
and theres 4 of them too so were gonna take advantage of that while were here
look how many tuk tuks there are
so we just finished watching chappie
which i thought was brilliant
i loved it, i actually cried
yeah i had a few tears welling
thats probably one of the most satisfying films ive watched in a long time
yeah i enjoyed
so as you can see behind me
theres a massive shopping center
this is one of the newer ones
and theres 3 more like this too
so chiang mai definitely has a better selection of shopping centres that chiang rai
definitely
and english films are a bonus
so sachas going to leave me alone now and go and do some shopping
coz i need to do another hyperlapse for my episode
im actually going to try and create a video entriely out of photos
so that should be quite interesting to watch
so your gonna go
yes im going
alright, dont spend too much
you know its food time dont you
good girl
gobble gobble gobble
sit
good girl
there you go
its been great using our friends office for a while and there super fast internet speed
we can get fast speeds in chiang rai too
because we live out on the farm the cables cant support fast upload speeds
were restricted to quite a low speed
so having a city enviroment and being close to the city has allowed us to use such afast speed here
and its something that we kind of feel we need now weve used it
saying that though, living on the farm has so many more benfits that
we may as well just upload our videos overnight
and just let it take its time
so we can live the relaxing farm lifestyle still
citylife is great but its not for us for a long time
as a note if you want to live outside of the city youre restricted to slower internet speeds
but chiang rai and chiang mai both have fast internet connections
availability
so youre not lost for that
further up north
it has been quite nice being back in chiang mai
i have to admit
this house, our friends house
is in a brilliant location
its litteraly
if we were to choose a house here in chiang mai this is the location we would choose
for city life
but thats it it is city life
very urban
now that weve been living in chiang rai for a while
in the farm and surrounded by nature
even chiang mai feels too busy for us now
we are liking it
i dont think we could live in the city again
permanently
after experiencing farm life
to be honest
but one thing we have noticed is like
where we live in chiang rai
you look out every window and theres mountain or scenery or banana fields and nature
and a farm walk
being in the city obviously youve got no choice
you have to be surrounded by other houses
and stuff
which can feel a bit chlostrophobic
but we are enjoying being close to everything and walking about
without having to drive everywhere
which is pretty cool
a lot of the houses in the city have bars and grates on the windows
which i dont know
just maybe its an additional security thing
it does lead you to believe that purhaps theres a higher posibility of someone breaking in
ive never felt unsafe living in chiang mai either
so thats a definite plus one for chiang rai
if you liek nature and you like being surrounded by peaceful places
chiang rai definitely tops it
one thing i noticed in particular about living back in chiang mai
in the city rather than on the farm
is going to bed at night and waking up in the morning
theres no cockerals
theres no night insect noises
or anything
its quiet here
theres not too much traffic noise
its just theres no nice nature noises
and thats something that i realyl miss
and i really like  where we are living on the farm in chiang rai
and you dont get that here
i miss my cockerals
after all the driving about and going to hotels
eating at restaurants for 3 times a day
its good to get back into being able to cook for ourselves
so thats why its nice to house sit
sachas cooking dinner
and then get ready for our day tomorrow where we are gonna be walking around the city
trying to get as much as the chiang mai experience as possible while were here
its gonna be fun
so there we have it
that is our chiang mai versus chiang rai comparisn video
a couple of people have actually asked us that very question
what is the difference between living in chiang mai to chiang rai
so we thought its the perfect time to do one while were back in chiang mai
we hope you liked it
after asking the question in the last video
about where you saw us from
we found out that quite a lot of you have come from retire cheap asia
so i just want to say thanks to jc for sharing our stuff
and if any of you guys are still in the forum
and think that people will find our stuff interesting
to see
feel free to share it in there too
because more people can benefit from seeing what living in thailand is like from our perspective
so thanks jc and thanks all you guys for sharing our stuff
it makes a big difference
dont forget to thumbs up, leave us a comment
and we will see you next time
bye
